 34namespace fft

 36
 37/// Determine whether the FFT size is a power of two.
 38inline bool 
 39is_power_of_two(unsigned size)
 40{
 41  return (size & (size - 1)) == 0;
 42}
 43template <dimension_type D>
 44inline bool 
 45is_power_of_two(Domain<D> const &dom)
 46{
 47  for (dimension_type d = 0; d != D; ++d)
 48    if (!is_power_of_two(dom[d].size())) return false;
 49  return true;
 50}
 51
 52/// Determine the exponent (forward or inverse) of a given Fft
 53/// from its parameters.
 54template <typename I, typename O, int sD> struct exponent;
 55template <typename T, int sD>
 56struct exponent<T, std::complex<T>, sD> { static int const value = -1;};
 57template <typename T, int sD>
 58struct exponent<std::complex<T>, T, sD> { static int const value = 1;};
 59template <typename T>
 60struct exponent<T, T, -2> { static int const value = -1;};
 61template <typename T>
 62struct exponent<T, T, -1> { static int const value = 1;};
 63
 64/// Determine the 'special dimension' of a real fft
 65/// from its parameters.
 66template <typename I, typename O, int S> 
 67struct axis { static int const value = S;};
 68template <typename T, int S>
 69struct axis<T, T, S> { static int const value = 0;};
 70
 71/// Device to calculate the size of the input and output blocks
 72/// for complex and real ffts.
 73template <dimension_type D, typename I, typename O, int A>
 74struct io_size
 75{
 76  static Domain<D> size(Domain<D> const &dom) { return dom;}
 77};
 78template <dimension_type D, typename T, int A>
 79struct io_size<D, std::complex<T>, T, A>
 80{
 81  static Domain<D> size(Domain<D> const &dom) 
 82  {
 83    Domain<D> retn(dom);
 84    Domain<1> &mod = retn.impl_at(A);
 85    mod = Domain<1>(0, 1, mod.size() / 2 + 1); 
 86    return retn;
 87  }
 88};
 89
 90
 91template <typename View>
 92View
 93new_view(vsip::Domain<1> const& dom) { return View(dom.size());} 
 94
 95template <typename View>
 96View 
 97new_view(vsip::Domain<2> const& dom)
 98{ return View(dom[0].size(), dom[1].size());}
 99
100template <typename View>
101View  
102new_view(vsip::Domain<3> const& dom)
103{ return View(dom[0].size(), dom[1].size(), dom[2].size());}
104
105
106
107template <typename View>
108View
109new_view(
110  vsip::Domain<1> const&                     dom,
111  typename View::block_type::map_type const& map)
112{ return View(dom.size(), map);} 
113
114template <typename View>
115View 
116new_view(
117  vsip::Domain<2> const&                     dom,
118  typename View::block_type::map_type const& map)
119{ return View(dom[0].size(), dom[1].size(), map);}
120
121template <typename View>
122View  
123new_view(
124  vsip::Domain<3> const&                     dom,
125  typename View::block_type::map_type const& map)
126{ return View(dom[0].size(), dom[1].size(), dom[2].size(), map);}
127
128
129
130/// Traits class to determine block type returned by Fft and Fftm
131/// by_value operators.
132
133/// General case: when result is distributed, we use a Dense block
134/// because Fast_blocks do support non-local maps (060512).
135template<typename T,
136	 typename BlockT,
137	 typename MapT = typename BlockT::map_type>
138struct result
139{
140  static dimension_type const dim = BlockT::dim;
141  typedef Dense<dim, T, tuple<0,1,2>, MapT> block_type;
142
143  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, T, block_type>::type view_type;
144
145  static view_type create(Domain<dim> const &dom, MapT const& map)
146  { return new_view<view_type>(dom, map);}
147};
148
149/// Specialization: when result is local, we use a Fast_block,
150/// because it lets us match complex format of the input block.
151template<typename T, typename BlockT>
152struct result<T, BlockT, Local_map>
153{
154  static dimension_type const dim = BlockT::dim;
155  typedef typename
156  impl::Fast_block<dim, T, 
157		   Layout<dim, tuple<0,1,2>,
158			  impl::Stride_unit_dense,
159			  typename Block_layout<BlockT>::complex_type>,
160		   typename BlockT::map_type> block_type;
161
162  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, T, block_type>::type view_type;
163
164  static view_type create(Domain<dim> const &dom, Local_map const&)
165  { return new_view<view_type>(dom);}
166};
167
168
169
170#ifndef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
171
172/// Traits class to determine view type returned by Fft for
173/// by_value operators with return-block optimization.
174
175template <dimension_type Dim,
176	  typename       InT,
177	  typename       OutT,
178	  typename       ViewT,
179	  typename       WorkspaceT,
180	  int            AxisV,
181	  int            ExponentV>
182struct Result_rbo
183{
184  typedef vsip_csl::expr::op::fft<Dim,
185				  fft::backend<Dim, InT, OutT, AxisV, ExponentV>,
186				  WorkspaceT> traits;
187  typedef typename traits::template Functor<typename ViewT::block_type> functor_type;
188  typedef expr::Unary<traits::template Functor, typename ViewT::block_type> block_type;
189  typedef typename View_of_dim<Dim, OutT, block_type const>::type view_type;
190};
191
192
193
194template <typename       InT,
195	  typename       OutT,
196	  typename       BlockT,
197	  typename       WorkspaceT,
198	  int            AxisV,
199	  int            ExponentV>
200struct Result_fftm_rbo
201{
202  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
203  typedef const_Matrix<InT, BlockT> in_view_type;
204  typedef vsip_csl::expr::op::fft<dim, fft::fftm<InT, OutT, AxisV, ExponentV>,
205				  WorkspaceT> traits;
206  typedef typename traits::template Functor<BlockT> functor_type;
207  typedef expr::Unary<traits::template Functor, BlockT> block_type;
208  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, OutT, block_type const>::type view_type;
209};
210
211#endif
